intro: Cyanotis hirtella, commonly known as the hairy bladderwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its small, aquatic or semi-aquatic growth habit and features whorled leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tiny, blue or violet flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to parts of Asia and is adapted to moist environments such as wetlands and marshes. Cyanotis hirtella plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
